result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Jo Valentin

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:07 PM Defendant Amy Jo Valentin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Amy Jo Valentin.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Christensen heard - case has been resolved.
Atty Christensen provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Christensen agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Christensen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 and 3.
Court orders presentence investigation be completed.  
Agent to provide report to court at least 2 weeks prior to sentencing. 
3:20 off record.
3:20 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Court orders Deft to cooperate with the PSI process.
Court revokes Deft's bond.
3:22 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

Defendant Amy Jo Valentin appeared by Zoom video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Travis Crowell in court for Amy Jo Valentin. 
3:01 p.m.
Copy of Information.
Waives reading.
Enters not guilty pleas.
3:04 p.m.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

3:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amy Jo Valentin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Amy Jo Valentin. 
Atty Christensen requests hearing.
ADA calls witness Officer Craig Haemker, sworn and examined.
Shown Exhibit #1 - Criminal Complaint - offered and received.
Atty Christensen cross-examines.
ADA provides argument.
Atty Christensen provides argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.
Court schedules with parties. 
3:48 pm
Arraignment scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

8:46 AM Defendant Amy Jo Valentin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mackenzie Christensen in court for Amy Jo Valentin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Christensen heard - has reviewed complaint with Deft.
Deft understands charges and penalties.
Waives formal reading.
Requests prelim within time limits.
Court schedules with parties.
8:47 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: **Filed in error per R.V. @ Public Defender's office**

9:10 AM Defendant Amy Jo Valentin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Court inquires on atty.
Atty Hansen is present and is heard.
Deft qualifies for PD, but an atty has not been appointed due to a conflict.
Atty Christensen is present and is heard - will take the case, pending a conflict check.
Court schedules with parties.
9:12 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:41 PM Defendant Amy Jo Valentin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Hansen appears in the courtroom.
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Hansen is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Atty Hansen heard - deft understands charges and penalties.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx, no contact with S.B., my not go to Michigan for any reason. 
Court schedules with parties.
1:49 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
